headline: Sweet and Sour Pork
description: This sweet and sour pork recipe is made with cubed pork and stir-fried vegetables, coated in a luscious pineapple sauce made with simple ingredients.

video.description: Discover the secrets to making succulent sweet and sour pork.
video.name: Sweet and Sour Pork IIII

name: Sweet and Sour Pork
recipeIngredient: 1 pound pork butt, cut into 1 inch cubes
3 stalks celery, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
1 medium green bell pepper, cut into 1 inch pieces
1 pinch white sugar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place cubed pork in a medium bowl and season with soy sauce, salt, and sugar for marinade. Add egg white and green onions and mix until well-combined. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Heat 1 quart oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C) in a large, heavy saucepan or deep fryer.
Coat pork with cornstarch and fry in hot oil until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels and set aside.
Heat oil for vegetables in a wok over medium heat. Stir in celery, bell pepper, and onion; cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Season with pinch of sugar and salt. Remove from heat and set aside.
Mix 1 cup water, 3/4 cup sugar, apple cider vinegar, ketchup, soy sauce, and salt in a large saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat.
Stir in cooked pork, celery mixture, and pineapple chunks with juice. Return to a boil, then mix in remaining1/4 cup water and cornstarch. Cook until thickened and warmed through, about 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Even the first time I made it; following the recipe but did not watch the video, it turned out so yummy! What provisions should I follow if using chicken breast instead of pork?

We really enjoyed this recipe. I ran out of sugar so only added what I had, which was a 1/2 cup for the sauce. That was actually just sweet enough for us. Other than that, I followed the recipes exactly as written. Next time I will add sliced carrots and broccoli for the extra veggies. Delish!
We liked it!

I had leftover pork roast that I cubed and seasoned the same, cooked briefly in the sesame oil, and did the rest the same as the recipe. Super fast! Super easy! And maybe one of the best fried rice Iâ€™ve ever had.
just perfect!
I have used this recipe a few times for various size groups and always a winner. Always better when standing a little.
Never fail best sweet and sour.. gluten free and delicious. I also substitute tofu sometimes but make it exactly the same. It is the best
This recipe turned out magnificently. My husband was quite impressed

I give this TEN stars, to match the accolades my guests gave it. The flavors were spot on. I looked at several easier recipes, most of which called for brown sugar to sweeten. I loved that this used the juice from the pineapple which I think made the flavor lighter yet perfectly as sweet as necessary. Kudos to Gramma! I cubed cutlets because they were on sale and I'm cheap. I added a large carrot, cut into quartered slices, to give it more color. I halved pearl onions instead of one large one because I had them and they were the right size. I did everything in my wok, deep fried the pork cubes a few at a time, poured off excess oil then threw in the veggies. As others recommended, I kept the sauce, the pork and the veggies separated until ready to serve which kept everything at a delightful crunchiness. Though my methodology differed, I didn't change the intrinsic things that make this recipe the best I've ever made. Thanks for sharing it!!
One of our favourite dishes. I make it all the time
Sooo yummy paired it with jasmine riceðŸ‘Œ 1 of my families new fav.
My husband and I both loved it! Best recipe Iâ€™ve tried! Thanks to her Grandma!
Delicious!

I made it almost exactly as the recipe stated, I don't measure things precisely. It is the best Sweet and Sour Pork ever! Hubby went back for seconds, and that's not usual for him. I thought it was delicious.
Best Sweet and Sour Pork.

I found that the number of pots and pans to be a monster for clean up . The flavor of the meat was very good . The color of the sauce is bland and this also goes for the flavor. The powdered corn starch I think , is a large contributor to this bland color and flavor . I have made this dish in the past using corn Syrup for the actual sauce. And did use the powdered cornstarch on the meat. I will not make this recipe again. For me other recipes for this dish give better flavor and presentation.
I used the juice of the canned pineapple, sugar substitute, and pan fried the meat. Next time I will use chicken. I sprinkled it with sesame seeds. My husband made brown rice.
Easy and do good!!!
Way to sweet for our taste and that was with less than the amount of sugar called for. Sorry. I don't think we could have eaten it made with the 3/4 cup sugar as stated in recipe
Delicious! I ran out of apple cider vinegar so I used white wine vinegar instead and it was fantastic. Added some mushrooms and bamboo shoots because I had them on hand. Great recipe
I loved this recipe ... especially that you could prepare the ingredients ahead of time. It was DELISH!!

This was awesome. I had been craving sweet and sour during the pandemic, not having eaten out or take-out for a year. 

This was the first time I made sweet and sour without using a store bought sauce. This is heads over anything you can buy in a bottle. 

Came out perfect the first time. If you are having a dinner party, you can prep the sauce and the pork ahead of time. The sauce can cool on the stove, keep the pork separate in a warming draw then combine for the last stage where you bring back to a boil and mix with the pork.

First the positives - we did like this recipe. I cut the pineapple/juice and white sugar each by 1/3 and it was the perfect sweetness for my whole family, I canâ€™t imagine using the full amount. But this recipe was a lot of work compared to Chef Johnâ€™s s&s pork tenderloin (my usual recipe. and no better than recipe, my usual recipe
we did this one night we all loved it I served it with white rice
This is my go to recipe for sweet and sour pork. Very easy to make and so full of flavor! My whole family absolutely loves it!

Love this. The 2nd time making it, I used shrimp.
Over the top good! Thanks for sharing.

This was so good! Did not have apple cider vinegar & had to use white vinegar, but otherwise followed recipe. Made rice in the instant pot earlier in the day to have ready for pork fried rice to serve with the meal. My husband is not a huge fan of Chinese food, but said he wanted me to make this recipe again.
Delicious! Made as written. I didn't have any green onions on hand so we went without. My wife and I loved it. I will be making it again, and will make sure I use the green onion.
Absolutely wonderful recipe, my guys are picky and they loved it. I will be making this again.

A great sweet & sour. The only change was I cut back on the sugar a bit otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly especially the liquids. I didn't have celery so substituted with sliced carrots. Nice colour. Definitely would make again but not too often due to sugar content.
Absolutely delicious. Hubby and I loved it. I will definitely make this again. I think itâ€™s better than what Iâ€™ve had in Chinese restaurants.

This recipe is absolutely "doable", jump right in and give it a try, you will be glad you did. You can feel good about creating a sauce that's not from a bottle with mystery ingredients that are unpronounceable. 
I highly recommend marinating the meat more than the one hour minimum the recipe advises. This dish has a universal appeal and lends itself well to adjustments individual families may prefer, as they "cook to taste".

Every year me and my family watch A Christmas Story on Christmas Eve and eat Chinese food as one of our traditions, and this is the first year weâ€™ve done homemade Chinese food but let me tell you this recipe is amazing. It wasnâ€™t too sweet and the sourness was perfect! Definitely going to make this more often!
I made this as written, and it came out really good.
Easy and good
Great recipe. Have made it a couple of times and it comes out wonderful!
Very tasty love it!?

I loved it!! I did not add the cooked pork (I used pork loin) to the sauce and veggies. I placed it on top of the cooked veggies and I served the veggies on top of rice. I also added chopped fresh green onions to the top as a garnish along with chow mein noodles for added crunch and a wedge of lime. I saved a bit of the sauce and drizzled it over the entire dish. It was amazing and I was so ready for good food. Oh, I did put a little less sugar then called for, maybe a half cup, give or take, it was perfect!!! Thank You!!
Not a fan. I think the Apple cider vinegar made it to tart.

Very good! Tried it with chicken instead of pork, and added broccoli, because had some to use up. I think whatever meat you use would be delicious and it would be good without as a vegan/vegetarian dish, without meat, as well. We will definitely be making this again!
This was delicious! The pork was tender and the sauce was very good!!!

Enjoyed this recipe! I used carrots, red bell & green bell peppers, white onions, and celery. For the pork, I used boneless pork chops because thatâ€™s what I had. I wasnâ€™t sure about the sauce alone, but with the port & veggies it was really good! I added the pineapple juice to the sauce and the pineapples with the veggies, then served the veggies & pork over rice and poured the a sauce over it all.

This dish is spectacular! This was a double batch, 8 servings. 
I added granulated garlic and ginger to the marinade. I used sesame oil to saute the veggies. Next time I will add small red chilies to spice it up and add fresh garlic to the sauteed veggies. Otherwise, it's perfection!
Tasted like it came from the chinese restaurant. Very yummy.

Didn't make the sauce portion, and had to substitute flour for cornstarch. Used a package of "stewing pork" that grocery store had discounted (no idea if blade or shoulder) and it turned out well. Definitely would try again.
For those, like me, who try not to submerge in oil and deep fry -- you must! The pork will cook more evenly, quicker, and not soak up as much oil. Trust me, from my experience.

I was nervous when I saw ketchup in the recipe, so I decided to make the sauce separate from the pork and veggies. I figured that if the sauce was horrible, I could make another one without wasting all the meat and veggies. It ended up being a precaution that wasnâ€™t necessary. This sauce was fabulous! I doubled the recipe for my large family, adding red bell pepper and carrots. I also used rice vinegar in lieu of apple cider vinegar. Otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly. It was fantastic! I will definitely be hanging onto this one. Thanks for sharing!

Great recipe! I was really surprised at how flavorful the meat was after marinating for only an hour. I ate several pieces while stir frying the veggies. Ignore comments about sauce being too thin or too sweet... it was perfect qnd I don't really like sweet/sugary stuff. Those that got thin sauce was probably user error. Boiling the liquids and sugar helps to thicken the sauce, think simple syrup. If you cut out most of the sugar you just made your sauce watery. I did follow the advice from some of the comments and did not cook the veggies or meat in the sauce. Once it was all done I tossed everything together in the sauce and put in a serving bowl. The pork and the veggies both had great texture. Definitely making this again!

This is really very good. We did everything in the work. Stir fried meat first in peanut oil then the veg. Made the sauce and put meat and veg back. Added extra apple cider vinegar as it was a bit sweet for our taste but this is a winning recipe and will 100% make it again. Once all the prep is done in advance it is really quick . Thanks for sharing.
Way too much ketchup. Everything just tasted like sour ketchup.

This recipe is easy and extremely good! It turned out way better than I was expecting and was honestly just as good, if not better than take out from any Chinese Food restaurant I've eaten at. Only thing I changed was I omitted the celery and added thinly sliced carrots, just because that's what I had on hand. It was perfect even without the celery. The sauce is the star of this show for sure. 
I made this recipe 4x the size because I had 4lbs of pork to use up, and I am so glad I did that. My entire family enjoyed this, even the little ones who I was pretty surprised about. 
This recipe is 100% worth making again & again.

This was so very good. The only thing I did different was I added different color bell peppers for the visual effect. And I did half pork & half chicken. 
Seriously some of the best sweet & sour pork & sweet & sour chicken I've ever had. 
Plus it was amazing days later as reheated leftovers. Definitely 5 stars.

I just made this recipe this evening and although it was a lot of prepping, it was well worth it! I cut up the pork into cubes, scallions, green peppers and onions, the day before and kept it for 24 hours in a big ziplock bag to marinate. This is what takes the longest so doing it beforehand will help especially if you have a busy schedule. I followed the recipe as stated and it was excellent! I served it with white rice from instant pot which was nice and fluffy. It was not overly sweet as another reviewer stated. For 3/4 cup of sugar itâ€™s blended in pretty well. Do not make any amendments to this recipe. It is amazing and tastes like authentic Asian takeout! I will be making this again.

ABSOLUTELY A KEEPER!!! Iâ€™m a sweet and sour pork aficionado, and this one is FANTASTIC! I canâ€™t imagine why anyone would need to change anything about the recipe. AND it heats up very well 2-3 days later!
Realy good and tasty

I've been making this recipe for years!!
Everyone loves it. Always my go to when making sweet and sour pork. Like some of the other reviews said I don't believe you need to use so much sugar especially if you use the juice from the pineapples. But the recipe is SWEET and sour pork so I get why there is so much sugar. ??
Anyways really good recipe I'd recommend to everyone.
The kids tell me itâ€™s there new favourite, I did add carrots

It was amazing! I didnâ€™t have green onions on hand, but had everything else. I omitted the celery, because it isnâ€™t my favorite. The meat would have been better if I had used a butt roast, but I had pork stew meat ready to go.
Delicious but, Difficult to differentiate between what ingredients are sauce and which are for the pork. It would better to have headings.
I added cornflour instead of cornstarch.
So delicious!

I made some changes based upon other reviews. I doubled the sauce as my husband loves a lot of sauce. However, I didn't double the sugar, using only one cup rather than 1 1/2 cups. It was still pretty sweet and would likely just use 3/4 cup the next time. I also didn't fry my pork, instead roasting a pork loin and adding it at the end. Also, didn't use celery and added carrots. Love it!
Excellent recipe!!

This is one of the nicest sweet and sour pork recipes ever. The sauce is not sharp, and the meat is crisp and crunchy (depending on how long it is deep fried). The only criticism I have is that although the list of ingredients is in order of use, it would be easier to follow if broken down into headings for the marinade, meat, veges and seasoning, and sauce. This is absolutely delicious and is one recipe I will be making again soon.
Delicious! Tastes like the real deal!
Great meal.
Your husband's gramma nailed it! I added a tablespoon of sesame oil into the finished meal to add that little extra Asian flavoring. Fantastic!

I wanted to leave a review because it turned out so well and my family liked it. I was forced to make several changes though, based on what ingredients I had in the house 
b/c grocery stores are understocked...I want to make that clear up front. I gave 5 stars for providing a great base knowledge. Used chicken not pork, stevia not sugar. b/c stevia reduced the volume, added 1/4c extra ketchup. I didn't weigh the meat, so it didn't look like 1/2c corn starch was enough so added 1/2c pillsbury gluten free fine flour and it was just enough to cover the meat. Only had a red pepper and added backyard wild onions. Added leftover cooked carrots that I didn't want to go to waste. I can only imagine how much better it will be when the recipe can be followed exactly. I'll give an update if I have a chance to make again.
I loved this recipe as well as my family. It was rather easy to make.
This was simply delightful! Huge hit in my house. Didnt have apple cider vinegar so used normal vinegar along with frozen Thai vege mix. Simple and delicious!

This is the best sweet and sour pork that I've ever had. It's a great recipe as is but I followed the tip on marinating the meat over night and I doubled the sauce. I am so happy that I doubled the sauce! Nothing but empty pans and full tummy's on this one. I will use this recipe from here on out. Thanks so much for the recipe, YOU ROCK GRANDMA!!!

Great recipe ! Thank you very much for sharing this ! I did make a few small changes , I used a variety of colorful peppers and I lessened the amount of sugar , I think I'll use the recipe amount of sugar next time and just lessen the quantity of the vinegar, it really came out great , for the first time. I doubled the recipe , so I could have left overs . Highly recommend it to anyone ! Really a nice dish. Thanks again
Yes I will make it again no changes
I made this for dinner and my husband really love it. It was not difficult and very tasty. The sweet and sour sauce was light which I really enjoyed.

This is a great recipe. Absolutely delicious. However, the prep time is wrong. Can you please make it at least 1h 30 to account for the marinating time? I forgot about that step and then went to make this starting at 6 PM ... no time to get it ready with the hour marinating time! I feel a little dumb, but altering the prep time might help others in the future. Thanks!
Best Sweet and Sour Pork I've EVER tasted!!!
Most authentic sweet & sour pork, hubby has had, outside of a Chinese restaurant, & oh, it is a favourite dish of his. Thank you!
I make this recipe all the time. Have used chicken also. AMAZING!!
I don't usually like sweet and sour pork, but my family does so I tried this recipe. Much to my surprise I loved this!
I reduced the added sugar to 3/8 of a cup and added a little more pineapple and carrot. Perhaps slightly too sweet for my taste but overall quite enjoyable.
No changes, and I would make it again. It had a great flavour and tasted better than I would get at the takeout. I did add mushrooms and I will add brocolli to the leftovers to enhance the food.

4.5 stars. I have another recipe for sweet and sour that I also like quite a bit. I would probably make this one again, but it is quite involved and takes 2 hours to make. I doubled the sauce due to other reviewers comments, but now I know it wasn't necessary. I ended up with twice as much sauce as I needed and will now need to freeze it for a future use. My sauce needed more than double the cornstarch mixture to get it to thicken also. I added sliced carrots for additional vegetables and color and was glad I did. It needs more vegetables than what the recipe calls for. Honestly, my other recipe that doesn't require frying the meat is just as good (if not better), and is healthier.

Excellent recipe. It is the first time I've ever made sweet and sour pork and it turned out great. The only change I made was to parboil the vegetables instead of frying them. I cooked them individually in a small amount of water until they were tender crisp and then used the water from the cooked vegetables to make my sauce. Less oil and more vitamins and flavor from the broth. I also substituted one carrot for one stalk of celery simply to give the dish a little more color since I didn't have any red or yellow peppers. Will definitely save this to do again.
I cut the sugar in half, and kept the sauce separate from the meat and vegetables to add right before serving.

Very good recipe. I did cut down on the sugar for the sauce to 1/2 cup. I added minced garlic, sliced zucchini, sugar snap peas pods to the recipe to add some color. I did not add the extra 1/4 cup of water at the end of end if the recipe because there was already plenty of liquid to work with. I also added red pepper flakes for extra flavor. I was pleasantly surprised as how yummy this is! I was afraid it would be too syrupy/liquidy, or just generally end up with a soggy mess, but none of that happened. I would have added fresh mushrooms too if I'd had any; I think the recipe as written is lacking in diversity and needs more veggies, which I did add some. I think baby corns would be great here too.
This was AMAZING! Better than in any restaurant I've ever been too~it's a little bit time consuming but it was worth it! I would definitely make this again and again! Thank you so much for sharing!
Great for the first time making this, tasty over steamed rice. Easy preparation as well.
Great recipe but just focus on what your end dish should taste like and adjust ingredients accordingly. EXCELLENT FLAVOR!

It smeed to be delicious; however, we felt disappointed because it was so sweet. Of course, I will try to prepare it again, and I consider it is a great dish, but next time I will add half sugar from the original recipe.

We really eat sweet food, just wanted something different. Oh my word such a lovely and delicious dish. Look I found the corn starch messy, but that's because I never work it before, not sure if my bag was to small but the meat parts weren't white like yours, still sticky and red. So I laid the meat out on a tray and sifted corn starch over them, turn repeated till they looked white. But next time I will try a larger bag. Everything else work perfectly. The meat was so tasty, tender, crunchy all in one, would not eat this too often only because of the sugar. But can't wait to try it out again. Thank you for sharing,.

This is the one! I lived in San Francisco for 20 years so I know good take out and this is it! I have tried many sweet and sour pork recipes, but this one beats them all. I made it as written and we ate it all. Empty plates returned to the kitchen means good food! Someone cut the sugar in half and didn't fry the pork and then gave it a 2 star, ignore that person. Listen, if you didn't follow the recipe then you shouldn't be rating it. What you're rating is YOUR recipe because YOU changed it.
Yummy, but I. It down the sugar a bit so it wasnâ€™t so sweet
It was great, easy to adjust to individual taste

I loved this easy to follow recipe. I doubled the amount of liquids to make double the sauce because my family loves their sauce. So much better than store bought sauce and the recipe is better than most restaurants. I will say that next time I will it dump the meat back into the sauce and that way left overs will be crispy.
I didn't fry the meat, but cooked in pressure cooker. Great recipe. Everybody loved it! Will definitely make again and may even fry the meat next time!

This was awesome!!! I have a deep fryer so that helped and the pork was done in about 4 minutes. It was tender on the inside and crunchy on the outside. Now that sauce, omg, I made a double batch, not that it needed it but I always feel like I need to feed an army when there is only two of us. Anytime I make a recipe I always make it as written and who is going to argue with a 94 yr old gramma, lol.
Used tinned lychees instead of pineapple and frozen stir fry Veges.
Very tasty, you wonâ€™t be disappointed

Made this tonight and it was wonderful. My husband said it tasted just like the kind you get at the restaurant. I think next time I may add a bit less sugar since my pineapple was very sweet. It was juice packed but was sweeter than some I've had. Anyway, we loved it and gobbled it up.
Loved this recipe! I changed the veggies...and it still tasted good! Thank you for sharing your recipe!
